author: Perez Hilton
title: Secret Service Requests $60 Million Extra In Funding For Trump Security

organizations.name: white house's office of management and budget

text:
Oh, awesome.
So, while Donald Trump is cutting funding for things like the EPA and Meals on Wheels -- he has no problem with the Secret Service needing $60 million more in 2018 to protect his fancy ass.
Why the increase, you ask?
According to the Washington Post , $26.8 million of that budget would be going to protect Melania Trump and their son, Barron , at the Trump Tower (as they do not live with Donny in the White House).
Related: Terror In London -- Get The Latest On The Westminster Attack 
As for the other $33 million -- that would supposedly cover travel costs incurred by "the president, vice president and other visiting heads of state." Or in other words, Drumpf's routine trips to his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida -- which he's been to five times in the last two months.
Not to mention, agents must also accompany Trump's sons as they travel around the world promoting Trump properties! Sorry tax payers!
This is certainly unprecedented additional costs!
Mind you, this is the same guy who said this on the campaign trail:
"There's no time for vacation. We're not going to be big on vacations.The White House is this incredible place. It represents so much, and you're there for a limited period of time. If you're at the White House and you have so much work to do, why do you fly? Why do you leave so much?"
We're wondering that same thing!
While the report didn't provide information for former presidents' spending, The Post said:
"The $26.8 million budget item is marked as $0 in previous years, which former Secret Service agents said likely meant that the costs were part of a new budget category designed to encapsulate the unusual expense of protecting the first lady and the president's youngest son because they live outside the White House."
An insider told the outlet the requests for additional funding have been rejected by the White House's Office of Management and Budget, but that just means the S.S. will have to find other ways to cover the costs.
Longtime Secret Service agent Jonathan Wackrow told The Post :
"The Secret Service cannot dictate the lifestyle of the protectee. They have to work around it. I don't think they expected him to go to Florida so often. This was an unanticipated reality."
Seeing a lot of that lately.
